column5: Hello Everyone,  What is the most effective size to use for soft plastics when fishing for Perch?  Thanks in advance for your expertise.
Slip float rigged with 1-1.5 inch tubes or curly tails. If you can get ahold of maggots,they rien surpream.
I can get a hold of maggots, it's just that they keep getting squished when I put them on the hook.
I like the 2" fin-s minnows, as well as what was already mentioned. The berkely power minnows are good too.....same size.  Sinker
Check my post on the Simcoe outing and it shows some great artificials for perch.
I use Berkely powerbait maggots when fishing with my daughter -- pretty effective and saves me having to slaughter worms every thirty seconds....  I think the ones I use are just over a centimetre.
fin-s minnow on a drop shot hook a foot over a jiggn rap #3
